title: Guided Studies
description: To attend seminars / workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.
outcome: The programme is research-oriented. It will follow a prescribed series of investigation and students should inform themselves in depth about the field of knowledge relevant to the topic of their projects. Students will be required to submit a research thesis and pass an oral examination for graduation.
syllabus: To be recommeded by Supervisor / Co-Supervisor.
recommended_readings: The reading materials to be recommended by Supervisor / Co-Supervisor.

title: Guided Studies
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis. This is equivalent to the Common Guided Studies for research methodology as required by the Faculty of Medicine.
outcome: The programme is research-oriented. It will follow a prescribed series of investigation and students should inform themselves in depth about the field of knowledge relevant to the topic of their projects. Students will be required to submit a research thesis and pass an oral examination for graduation.
syllabus: To be recommended by Supervisor / Co-Supervisor.
recommended_readings: The reading materials to be recommended by Supervisor / Co-Supervisor.

title: Seminar
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous term/year.
outcome: The programme is research-oriented. It will follow a prescribed series of investigation and students should inform themselves in depth about the field of knowledge relevant to the topic of their projects. Students will be required to submit a research thesis and pass an oral examination for graduation.
syllabus: To be recommended by Supervisor / Co-Supervisor.
recommended_readings: The reading materials to be recommended by Supervisor / Co-Supervisor.

instructors:
Professor LI Zheng, 
Professor NG Chi Fai, 
Professor NG Siu Man Simon, 
Professor WONG Kwok Chu
